summary: Comprehensive testing of SoundMirror Phonetic Display Fix - All critical features verified working. The main fix (vowel separation for 'I'm fine' → 'Aeem faeen') is confirmed working correctly.

minor_issues.issue: Word 'later' in 'See you later' not fully phonetized - shows 'later' instead of 'leh-eet-er'
minor_issues.note: Not in WORD_PHONETICS dictionary, fallback rules not catching all patterns

passed_tests.result: PASS ✓ - Accepts POST, returns ipaSequence and durationMs
PASS ✓ - Quick Practice words and Phrases visible and clickable
PASS ✓ - WORD/PHRASE, PHONETIC, and SOUNDS columns correctly displayed
PASS ✓ - Alphabet keyboard and animation panels visible
PASS ✓ - Play button present and clickable
PASS ✓ - Begin Practice button visible in recording panel
PASS ✓ - SoundMirror splash screen and navigation visible

key_phonetic_rules.vowels_separated: Yes - 'I' = 'Aeem' (long open + high vowel, not a glide)

ui_elements_verified: Word Practice page loads with Quick Practice buttons
Phrases section shows 'I'm fine', 'Thank you', etc.
Phonetic column displays correctly formatted phonetics
Sounds column shows individual sound breakdown
Animation controls (Play, Speed, Audio toggle) present
Letter Practice keyboard visible with A-Z, CH, SH, TH
Recording panel with camera/mic button present

camera_microphone_note: Camera/microphone button is present in the recording panel. The actual camera access may fail in sandboxed testing environment due to browser permission restrictions - this is EXPECTED behavior. The code has proper error handling for permission denied scenarios.

mocked_apis.ai_grading_fallback: MOCKED - Falls back to random scores when Gemini unavailable

action_items: OPTIONAL: Add 'later' to WORD_PHONETICS dictionary in phoneticDisplay.js for complete phrase phonetization
critical_code_review_comments: phoneticDisplay.js correctly implements the Pronunciation Rule Sheet with vowel separation
WORD_PHONETICS dictionary has comprehensive coverage of common words
IPA_TO_READABLE mapping correctly separates diphthongs (aɪ→'a-ee', not 'ai')
Magic-e handling works correctly for i_e and a_e patterns
Backend Allosaurus integration working - returns empty ipaSequence for short audio as expected
seed_data_creation: Test sessions created and cleaned up during pytest execution
context_for_next_testing_agent: The main phonetic display fix for 'I'm fine' → 'Aeem faeen' is working correctly. All vowels are now separated and long per the Pronunciation Rule Sheet. Backend APIs all pass. Camera testing may fail in sandboxed environment - this is expected. Minor issue: 'later' word not in dictionary.
